trans-unit.source: Depending on your Visual Studio settings, when an exception is thrown in Stride, Visual Studio might only show the call stack from the Stride runtime .DLL files or .NET framework assemblies, not user code.
trans-unit.target: Depending on your Visual Studio settings, when an exception is thrown in Stride, Visual Studio might only show the call stack from the Stride runtime .DLL files or .NET framework assemblies, not user code.

trans-unit.source: To break as soon as an exception is thrown, add additional conditions to the Visual Studio Exception Settings.
trans-unit.target: To break as soon as an exception is thrown, add additional conditions to the Visual Studio Exception Settings.

trans-unit.source: In the Visual Studio toolbar, under the Debug menu, select Windows > Exception Settings.
trans-unit.target: In the Visual Studio toolbar, under the Debug menu, select Windows > Exception Settings.

trans-unit.source: Expand Common Language Runtime Exceptions and select All Common Language Runtime Exceptions not in this list. You might need to select other conditions too.
trans-unit.target: Expand Common Language Runtime Exceptions and select All Common Language Runtime Exceptions not in this list. You might need to select other conditions too.

trans-unit.source: All common language runtime exceptions not in this list
trans-unit.target: All common language runtime exceptions not in this list

trans-unit.source: !Tip To restore the default list of exceptions, right-click and select Restore Defaults.
trans-unit.target: !Tip To restore the default list of exceptions, right-click and select Restore Defaults.

trans-unit.source: For more information about managing exceptions in Visual Studio, see Manage exceptions with the debugger in Visual Studio in the Microsoft Visual Studio documentation.
trans-unit.target: For more information about managing exceptions in Visual Studio, see Manage exceptions with the debugger in Visual Studio in the Microsoft Visual Studio documentation.
